text.tspan: Precondition: the subtree l is black at height h,
the other subtree is black-rooted at h+1.
The far child of the sibling is an RT. We will
blacken it and do a rotation.
The far child of the sibling is an RT. We cannot
blacken it, so we next look to blacken rl.
The new root is now a valid RT(h+1), as was
the root before deletion, so we're done.
Test the color of the root of rr.
The new root is now a valid BT(h+2), as was
the root before deletion, so we're done.
Single rotate left. Blacken rr to be a BT(h+1). Color the new root with the old color.
The near child of the sibling is an RT. This red will be
blackened in the course of a double rotation.
The root was previously RT(h+1). It is now RT(h+1).
The root was previously BT(h+2). It is now BT(h+2).
Double rotate left. Color previous root black. Color new root with color of previous root.
Both children of the sibling are black, so we can
We have a BT(h+1). The root was red, so it
was an RT(h+1). We are done.
We have a BT(h+1). The root was black, so it
was a BT(h+2). We pass up the violation.
Redden subtree at rv. If the root is black, pass up the violation; else blacken the root and finish.
Test the color of the root of rl.
